asana.description: A fundamental standing pose with feet together, arms at sides, and active engagement of all muscles. Develops concentration, stability, and balanced posture.
Establishes proper alignment, grounding, and body awareness. The foundation for all standing poses.
Establishes proper seated alignment, strengthens the core and back muscles, and improves posture. Foundation for seated poses.
A neutral position on hands and knees with a flat back. Foundation for cat-cow, bird dog, and transitions like Downward Dog.
Builds heat and strength in the legs, glutes, and core. Challenges endurance and focus.
Strengthens legs and core, stretches hip flexors. Challenges balance with back knee lifted.
Deep twisting pose that combines the leg strength of Crescent Lunge with a powerful spinal rotation. Improves balance, digestion, and detoxification while stretching hips and shoulders.
Deeply stretches the side body, opens hips and chest, and strengthens legs. Builds stamina.
Standing forward fold with hands placed under the feet (palms up). Deeply stretches hamstrings, calves, and wrists.
Challenges balance, stretches hamstrings and hips, and strengthens the standing leg and core.
Forward fold variation from Warrior 1 with hands interlaced behind back. Deeply opens shoulders and hips, promotes surrender.
Creates a side bend and opens the side waist while maintaining Warrior 2 leg stance. Builds strength and grace.
Stretches hamstrings, groins, and hips while opening the chest and shoulders. Improves stability and alignment.
Strengthens legs and core, opens chest and shoulders, stretches hip flexors. Builds stability, focus, and confidence.
Strengthens legs and arms, opens hips and chest. Builds stamina, focus, and determination.
Stretches hamstrings, calves, and back. Calms the mind, relieves stress, and can improve digestion.
Lengthens the spine, stretches hamstrings lightly. Often used as a transition in Sun Salutations to prepare for stepping or jumping back.
Deeply stretches the entire back body (spine, hamstrings, calves). Calms the nervous system, promotes introspection.
Stretches inner thighs, hamstrings, and spine. Calms the mind, relieves mild back tension. Variations include different hand/arm positions.
Advanced standing balance requiring hip flexibility, hamstring length, core strength, and focus. Combines a bind with leg extension.
Variation of Half Moon Pose involving a bind between the top arm and lifted leg. Deeply opens the chest and challenges balance.
Combines balance, strength, flexibility, and focus. Opens the chest and shoulders, stretches the hip flexors and quads.
Improves balance, concentration, and joint stability (ankles, knees, wrists). Stretches shoulders and upper back.
Challenges balance while strengthening legs and core. Opens hips and chest, improves coordination.
Challenges balance and hamstring flexibility. Strengthens the standing leg. A forward fold with one leg extended upwards.
Improves balance, concentration, and stability. Strengthens ankles and legs, opens hips gently.
Balancing pose that strengthens the entire back body, legs, and core. Improves focus, coordination, and posture.
Seated spinal twist energizes the spine, stimulates digestion, and improves spinal mobility. Stretches hips, shoulders, and neck.
Gentle supine twist that releases tension in the spine and back muscles. Promotes relaxation and can aid digestion.
Performed lying on the back, knees drop to one side while gazing opposite. Gentle spinal rotation, releases lower back.
Combines the strength of Chair Pose with a deep spinal twist. Detoxifies organs, builds heat, challenges balance.
Combines a deep twist with a hamstring stretch. Improves balance, aids digestion, strengthens legs and core.

asana.sanskrit: Parsva Balasana / Urdhva Mukha Pasasana variation
asana.description: Gentle twist from Table Top. Releases tension in the upper back, shoulders, and neck.
Seated pose opening the hips and inner thighs. Can be practiced upright or folded forward. Stimulates pelvic region.
Deep squat opening hips, groin, and lower back. Stretches ankles. Grounding and beneficial for digestion and elimination.
Intense hip opener focusing on the external rotation of the front leg hip and stretching the hip flexor of the back leg. Often practiced folding forward (Sleeping Pigeon).
Supine pose opening hips and inner groin. Gently releases lower back and sacrum. Calming and playful.
Deep hip and groin opener, stretches hamstrings, hip flexors, and quads. Can be practiced on hands or forearms.
Stretches hip flexors (psoas) and quadriceps of the back leg. Builds stability. Back knee rests on the ground.
A foundational lunge with the back knee on or hovering above the ground. Builds strength in the legs while opening the hip flexors and preparing for deeper poses.
Upright variation of the hip opener, often incorporating a backbend (King Pigeon) or quad stretch. Opens hips and chest.
Restorative supine pose opening hips, inner thighs, and chest gently. Promotes relaxation and stress relief.
Strengthens core, back muscles, and glutes while improving balance and stability. Done from Table Top.
Strongly engages core muscles (abdominals, hip flexors) and strengthens the spine. Improves balance and concentration.

asana.sanskrit: Makara Adho Mukha Svanasana / Phalakasana II
asana.description: Strengthens core, arms, shoulders, and legs. Builds endurance. Body forms a straight line supported on forearms and toes.
Strengthens arms (triceps), shoulders, wrists, and core. A key transitional pose in Vinyasa yoga (Sun Salutations).
Builds full body strength, particularly core, shoulders, arms, and wrists. Improves posture and stability.
Strengthens wrists, arms, shoulders, core (obliques), and legs. Improves balance and coordination.
Strengthens the entire back body, opens chest, shoulders, and hip flexors. Stimulates abdominal organs and improves posture.
Gentle backbend opening chest and shoulders, strengthening glutes, hamstrings, and back. Calming yet energizing.
Deep backbend opening the entire front body (chest, abdomen, hip flexors, quads). Energizing and emotionally releasing.
Gentle backbend strengthening the spine, arms, and glutes. Opens chest and shoulders. Foundational backbend.
Performed on hands and knees, dropping the belly, lifting chest and gaze. Gently stretches front torso and neck. Paired with Cat Pose.
Opens chest, throat, and shoulders. Stretches front of neck and hip flexors (psoas). Often used as a counterpose to Shoulder Stand.
Strengthens the entire back body (spine, glutes, hamstrings). Improves posture and prepares for deeper backbends.
Stronger backbend than Cobra, opening chest and shoulders while strengthening arms, wrists, and spine. Thighs and knees lift off the floor.
Deep backbend opening the entire front body. Strengthens arms, legs, spine, and abdomen. Highly energizing.
Exuberant backbend and heart opener, entered from Side Plank or Downward Dog. Builds strength, flexibility, and freedom.
Fundamental arm balance building strength in arms, wrists, and core. Improves focus, balance, and confidence.
Strengthens shoulders, arms, and core while stretching hamstrings and opening shoulders. Preparation for forearm stand and headstand.
Full body stretch and strengthener. Lengthens spine, opens shoulders, stretches hamstrings and calves, builds arm strength. Mild inversion.
Advanced arm balance requiring significant core, arm, and wrist strength, plus hamstring and hip flexibility.
Advanced arm balance combining hip opening (like Pigeon Pose) with arm strength and balance.
Full inversion known as the "king" of poses. Improves circulation, balance, focus, and core strength. Requires proper instruction.
Advanced arm balance strengthening wrists, forearms, and core. Improves digestion through abdominal pressure.
Inversion stretching the spine, shoulders, and back of legs. Calms the nervous system, stimulates thyroid.
Full inversion known as the "queen" of poses. Calms nervous system, stimulates thyroid and parathyroid glands, improves circulation.
Variation of Downward Dog lifting one leg. Opens hips, strengthens shoulders and core, prepares for transitions.
Performed on hands and knees, rounding the spine upward, tucking chin to chest. Stretches back torso and neck. Paired with Cow Pose.
Variation of Low Lunge with arms extended overhead, often with a gentle backbend. Opens chest and shoulders, deepens hip flexor stretch.
Comfortable cross-legged seated position for meditation, pranayama, or centering. Promotes calm and hip opening over time.
Kneeling side stretch opening the side body, shoulders, hamstrings, and hips. Improves flexibility along the intercostal muscles.
Kneeling pose stretching thighs, knees, and ankles. Improves posture and digestion. Can be used for meditation.
Relaxed variation of Forward Fold with bent knees, soft spine, and loose arms. Releases tension in spine, shoulders, and hamstrings. Calms the nervous system.
Resting pose gently stretching hips, thighs, ankles, and back. Calms the mind and nervous system. Promotes release and surrender.
Final relaxation pose. Allows the body and mind to integrate the benefits of the practice. Promotes deep rest and rejuvenation.
A challenging variation of Table Top with knees lifted slightly off the ground, engaging the core and building strength in the shoulders and arms.
A gentler variation of Bridge Pose where one leg is extended while the other foot remains on the ground, creating an asymmetrical backbend.
A restorative lateral stretch performed lying on the back with arms and legs extending to one side in a crescent shape, stretching the entire side body.
A dynamic core strengthening pose where opposite knee and elbow connect under the body from table top position, challenging balance and coordination.
A dynamic backbending pose performed from Table Top where one leg extends backward and upward while grabbing the foot, creating a bow-like shape.
A standing twist variation of Mountain Pose where the arms are extended and the torso rotates while maintaining firm grounding through the feet.
A variation of Mountain Pose with arms extended overhead and a gentle backbend, opening the front body and stretching the shoulders.
A side-bending variation of Mountain Pose with arms overhead and upper body extending to one side, stretching the intercostal muscles and lateral spine.
A preparatory hamstring stretch with the front leg extended forward, back knee down, and torso folding over the front leg.
A modified plank position with knees on the ground, making it accessible while still strengthening the upper body and core.
A twisting variation of Downward Facing Dog where one hand reaches under the body to the opposite shin, creating a rotational stretch through the spine and shoulders.
A twisting variation of Chair Pose with arms extended to either side, creating an open twist that challenges balance and core strength.
A variation of Chair Pose with heels lifted off the ground, increasing the challenge to balance and strengthening the calves and ankles.
A variation of Chair Pose with arms extended to the sides like airplane wings, adding upper body engagement and changing the weight distribution.
A challenging variation of Crescent Lunge with both knees bent at 90 degrees and torso upright, building strength and balance.
A powerful variation of Crescent Lunge with arms raised overhead, creating length through the side body and a deeper hip flexor stretch.
A variation of Crescent Lunge with arms extended to the sides, activating the upper back and helping to stabilize the posture.
A binding variation of Extended Side Angle where the bottom arm threads under the front thigh and the top arm reaches around the back.

transitions.transition: Extended Side Angle with Full Bind

asana.description: A wide-legged standing pose with arms extended to the sides like a star, creating a foundation for strength and stability.
A wide-legged squat with feet turned out and torso upright, building strength in the lower body and opening the hips.
A balancing pose where one foot lifts off the ground while maintaining the alignment of Mountain Pose, building focus and stability.
A twisting variation of One Leg Mountain with arms extended and torso rotated, challenging balance while adding spinal rotation.
A standing balance pose where one leg extends forward at hip height, creating an L-shape with the body while maintaining alignment.
A one-legged squat with the other leg extended, combining strength, balance, and flexibility in a challenging pose.
A variation of Triangle Pose where the torso rotates upward rather than sideways, emphasizing different muscles and creating a backbending element.

asana.sanskrit: Eka Pada Adho Mukha Svanasana Janu Nasika
asana.description: A dynamic core-strengthening variation where the raised leg bends and knee draws in toward the nose, engaging the abdominals and building heat.

asana.sanskrit: Eka Pada Adho Mukha Svanasana Parivrtta
asana.description: A twisting core variation where the raised leg bends and knee draws toward the opposite tricep, creating a strong oblique engagement and spinal rotation.
A variation of Three-Legged Dog where the lifted leg opens to the side and the hips stack, creating a star-like shape and deep hip opening.

asana.sanskrit: Eka Pada Adho Mukha Svanasana Hip Open
asana.description: A hip-opening variation of Three-Legged Dog where the knee bends and the hip opens to the side, creating space in the hip joint and increasing external rotation.
A variation of Side Plank performed on the forearm instead of the hand, providing more stability while still engaging the core and side body.

asana.sanskrit: Utthan Pristhasana Eka Pada Rajakapotasana Prep
asana.description: A variation of Runner's Lunge where the back foot is grabbed with the same-side hand, creating a deep quadriceps and hip flexor stretch.
A deep hip-opening lunge with the front foot stepped to the outer edge of the mat and forearms or hands on the ground inside the front leg.
A twisting variation of Dancer Pose where the torso rotates while maintaining the backbend and balance, adding complexity and new lines of energy.
An intense backbending balance pose where the leg is pulled up behind while the torso reaches forward, creating a bow shape while standing.
A balance pose where the torso is parallel to the floor with arms extended to the sides like airplane wings, strengthening the back body.
A powerful balance pose where the torso and one leg extend forward and back in a horizontal line, building strength, focus, and stability.
A backbending variation of Half Moon where the top hand grasps the lifted foot, creating a bow-like shape while maintaining the balance.
A standing hip opener where one ankle crosses above the opposite thigh in a figure-four shape, creating space in the outer hip and glutes.
A twisting variation of Figure 4 where the torso rotates while maintaining the hip-opening leg position, adding spinal mobility to the pose.
A twisting variation of Standing Big Toe Pose where the extended leg moves across the body, creating a spinal rotation while balancing.
An advanced backbending variation of Pigeon Pose where the back foot is drawn toward the head, creating a deep opening in the quadriceps, hip flexors, and spine.
A variation of Half Pigeon with both knees bent at 90-degree angles, one in front and one to the side, creating a gentle hip and inner thigh opening.
A wide stance lunge with one leg extended to the side and the other bent, creating a deep inner thigh and hamstring stretch.
A seated pose where legs stack with knees aligned and arms reach in opposite directions behind the back, opening hips, shoulders, and chest.
A seated variation of Figure 4 where one ankle crosses over the opposite thigh, creating a gentle external hip rotation and glute stretch.
A seated pose where legs stack with shins parallel like stacked logs, creating an intense external hip rotation and opening for the outer hips.
A deep hip opener performed face down with knees wide and bent at 90 degrees, creating an intense inner thigh and groin stretch.
A one-sided variation of Frog Pose where one leg extends while the other bends outward, creating an asymmetrical hip and quad stretch.
An asymmetrical variation of Camel Pose where one hand reaches back to the heel while the other arm extends upward, creating a spiraling backbend.
A variation of Bridge Pose where one leg extends upward, creating an asymmetrical backbend that challenges balance and core stability.
A full backbend from a supine position with hands and feet pressing into the floor, lifting the entire body into an arch shape.
A seated twist with one leg extended and the other bent, with the opposite arm wrapping around the bent knee to create spinal rotation.
A seated forward fold with legs spread wide, stretching the inner thighs, hamstrings, and spine while calming the nervous system.
A seated pose with one leg extended upward while the upper body reclines, creating a deep hamstring stretch with the gaze toward the ceiling.
A restorative inversion where the legs rest vertically against a wall while the back is on the floor, promoting circulation and relaxation.
A restorative chest opener performed face down with arms extended to the sides, releasing tension in the chest, shoulders, and neck.
A twisting arm balance where the knees rest on one arm while the body rotates, challenging oblique strength and wrist stability.
An advanced variation of Side Crow where the body extends parallel to the floor, requiring significant core and arm strength.
A variation of Crow Pose where one leg extends back or to the side, challenging core strength and balance in the arm balance.
A variation of headstand with the crown of the head and hands forming a triangular base, with legs extended overhead for a full inversion.
An advanced inversion balancing on the forearms with the body aligned vertically overhead, building shoulder strength and confidence.
A challenging backbending variation of Forearm Stand where the legs bend toward the head, creating a deep heart opening and spinal flexibility.
An advanced variation of Wheel Pose where one leg extends upward, creating an asymmetrical backbend requiring strength and balance.
A deep backbend variation of Wheel Pose performed on the forearms instead of hands, creating an intense heart and shoulder opening.
A deep forward fold where arms slide under the legs and extend outward while the torso folds between the legs, creating a turtle-like shape.
An arm balance where the knees draw into the chest as the body lifts off the floor, creating a pendant-like shape suspended on straight arms.
An advanced standing balance with one leg extended while binding through and around the standing leg, requiring flexibility, balance, and strength.
An advanced arm balance where the entire body is parallel to the floor, supported by the hands with elbows pressing into the abdomen.
An advanced arm balance variation where the chin rests on the floor while the legs extend overhead, requiring significant shoulder and core strength.
An advanced arm balance combining hip opening with arm strength as one leg tucks into the opposite arm while the other extends behind.
An advanced arm balance where one leg wraps around the arm while the other extends, creating a twisting side balance requiring flexibility and strength.
A preparatory version of Grasshopper Pose, practicing the leg wrap around the arm with modifications to build toward the full pose.
A deep hamstring and hip flexor stretch with legs extended in opposite directions, creating a straight line from heel to heel.
A challenging standing pose with one foot placed at the opposite inner thigh while bending forward into the lifted leg, requiring balance and flexibility.
A deep squatting balance pose where one foot tucks under while sitting on the heel with the other leg in half lotus, challenging balance and hip flexibility.
A deep backbend from a kneeling position with the hands reaching back to grasp the feet or ankles, creating an intense front body opening.
The classic meditation pose where both feet rest on the opposite thighs, creating deep external rotation in the hips and a stable seated foundation.
A preparatory version of Lotus with only one foot on the opposite thigh, making the hip-opening seated position more accessible.
A variation of Lotus Pose with the arms bound behind the back, adding a shoulder and chest opening to the hip-opening seated position.
An arm balance variation of Lotus where the entire body lifts off the ground, supported by straight arms pressing into the floor.
An advanced arm balance from Lotus Pose with the arms threaded through the lotus legs, lifting the entire body off the ground.
A balancing backbend in half lotus where one leg forms a half lotus while the other leg extends behind with the same-side hand grasping the foot.
An advanced arm balance with legs extended straight out to the sides while balancing on the hands, requiring hamstring flexibility and arm strength.
A seated pose with one leg extended upward grasped by the hands while the other leg is folded, creating an intense hamstring stretch.
A seated twist and hamstring stretch where one leg extends to the side while both hands grasp the foot and the torso rotates toward the extended leg.
An arm balance where one leg extends over the shoulder while seated on one buttock, requiring core strength and shoulder opening.
An advanced arm balance where both legs wrap around one arm and extend to the side, requiring core strength and shoulder mobility.
A dynamic movement combining a squat with arms curling upward, creating a fluid strength-building motion often practiced with a ball or prop.
A standing twisting pose with hands in prayer position. Deepens the twist, improves spinal flexibility, and aids in detoxification. Often performed from Chair or Crescent Lunge.

A restorative pose lying face down with arms extended and head turned to one side. Promotes deep relaxation, helps release tension in the lower back, and provides a gentle stretch to the front of the body.

A restorative pose lying on the back with arms and legs spread wide, like a star or cosmic being. Promotes complete surrender, deep relaxation, and a sense of expansion and connection to the universe.
A calming resting pose lying on your side with knees drawn toward chest and arms wrapped around legs or pillowing the head. Promotes feelings of security, comfort, and relaxation.
